page.title: 01Background notes.
page.content: This rural area of North-east Fife has wind-swept picturesque, undulating scenery of mainly arable land freely dotted with mixed woodland and rough hill-tops.Between the low hills runs the Motray Water and its many small tributaries The area is cut in half by the very busy A914 road which connects Dundee and Kirkcaldy and closely follows the line of the burn. The main habitations are the tiny hamlets of Kilmany and Rathillet, both of which lie just on the south side of the main road,and the few farms scattered throughout the district.
